verses.verse: The Valley of Dry Bones (Ezek 1.3; 8.3; Lk 4.1; Acts 8.39) The hand of the LORD came upon me, and he brought me out by the spirit of the LORD and set me down in the middle of a valley; it was full of bones.
He led me all around them; there were very many lying in the valley, and they were very dry.
(Deut 32.39; 1 Sam 2.6; Isa 26.19) He said to me, “Mortal, can these bones live?” I answered, “O Lord GOD, you know.”
Then he said to me, “Prophesy to these bones and say to them: O dry bones, hear the word of the LORD.
(vv 9, 10|EZK 37:910; Ps 104.29, 30) Thus says the Lord GOD to these bones: I will cause breath (Or wind or spirit) to enter you, and you shall live.

(Ezek 6.7; 35.12; Joel 2.27; 3.17) I will lay sinews on you and will cause flesh to come upon you and cover you with skin and put breath (Or wind or spirit) in you, and you shall live, and you shall know that I am the LORD.”
So I prophesied as I had been commanded, and as I prophesied, suddenly there was a noise, a rattling, and the bones came together, bone to its bone.
I looked, and there were sinews on them, and flesh had come upon them, and skin had covered them, but there was no breath in them.

(Ps 104.30; Hos 13.14) Then he said to me, “Prophesy to the breath, prophesy, mortal, and say to the breath: (Or wind or spirit) Thus says the Lord GOD: Come from the four winds, O breath, (Or wind or spirit) and breathe upon these slain, that they may live.”
(vv 5, 6|EZK 37:56; Rev 11.11) I prophesied as he commanded me, and the breath came into them, and they lived and stood on their feet, a vast multitude.
(Ps 141.7; Isa 49.14; Ezek 36.10; 39.25) Then he said to me, “Mortal, these bones are the whole house of Israel. They say, ‘Our bones are dried up, and our hope is lost; we are cut off completely.’

(v 25|EZK 37:25; Isa 26.19; Ezek 36.24; Hos 13.14; Am 9.14, 15) Therefore prophesy and say to them: Thus says the Lord GOD: I am going to open your graves and bring you up from your graves, O my people, and I will bring you back to the land of Israel.
(Ezek 6.7) And you shall know that I am the LORD when I open your graves and bring you up from your graves, O my people.
(Ezek 36.27, 36; 39.29) I will put my spirit within you, and you shall live, and I will place you on your own soil; then you shall know that I, the LORD, have spoken and will act, says the LORD.”
The Two Sticks The word of the LORD came to me:

(Num 17.2; 2 Chr 11.11-17; 15.9) Mortal, take a stick and write on it, “For Judah and the Israelites associated with it”; then take another stick and write on it, “For Joseph (the stick of Ephraim) and all the house of Israel associated with it”;
and join them together into one stick, so that they may become one in your hand.
And when your people say to you, “Will you not show us what you mean by these?”

(Zech 10.6) say to them, “Thus says the Lord GOD: I am about to take the stick of Joseph (which is in the hand of Ephraim) and the tribes of Israel associated with it, and I will put the stick of Judah upon it (Heb I will put them upon it) and make them one stick, in order that they may be one in my hand.”
When the sticks on which you write are in your hand before their eyes,

(Ezek 36.24; 39.27) then say to them, “Thus says the Lord GOD: I will take the people of Israel from the nations among which they have gone and will gather them from every quarter and bring them to their own land.

(Isa 11.13; Jer 3.18; Ezek 34.23; Hos 1.11) I will make them one nation in the land, on the mountains of Israel, and one king shall be king over them all. Never again shall they be two nations, and never again shall they be divided into two kingdoms.

(Ezek 11.18; 36.25, 28; 43.7) They shall never again defile themselves with their idols and their detestable things or with any of their transgressions. I will save them from all the apostasies into which they have fallen (Cn: MT from all the settlements in which they have sinned) and will cleanse them. Then they shall be my people, and I will be their God.
(Isa 40.11; Jer 30.9; Ezek 36.27; Hos 3.5) “My servant David shall be king over them, and they shall all have one shepherd. They shall follow my ordinances and be careful to observe my statutes.

(Ezek 28.25; 36.28; Zech 6.12) They shall live in the land that I gave to my servant Jacob, in which your ancestors lived; they and their children and their children’s children shall live there forever, and my servant David shall be their prince forever.

(Isa 55.3; Ezek 20.40; 36.10; 43.7) I will make a covenant of peace with them; it shall be an everlasting covenant with them, and I will bless (Tg: Heb give) them and multiply them and will set my sanctuary among them forevermore.
(Lev 26.11; Jn 1.14) My dwelling place shall be over them, and I will be their God, and they shall be my people.
(Ezek 20.12; 36.23) Then the nations shall know that I the LORD sanctify Israel, when my sanctuary is among them forevermore.”
